review_text:
My partner and I had a really nice stay at this cabin over labor day weekend. Marlene was really helpful about planning a few lovely surprises for my partner. She created a lovely display of chocolates, local wine, beautiful flowers, and baked treats that were waiting for us on the table when we arrived. They also allowed us to rent a couple kayaks and Marlene's husband dropped us off up river for a truly fantastic afternoon on the water. We saw bald eagles, hawks, turtles, and jumping Asian Carp, and didn't see another person the whole time! After 3-4 hours on the water, we pulled up right beside the house. Super easy!
The cabin was very clean and well appointed inside, though the exterior is a little buggy (mostly harmless spiders, but one or two stinging bugs to look out for). It has a fairly new interior with newer windows and doors. The kitchen contains a full-sized range, oven, and microwave, and a mini-fridge. The bedroom has a queen sized bed with a soft mattress on a wobbly frame. The mattress had a thick plastic cover under the fitted sheet which was both a little noisy and somewhat uncomfortable (sweaty) to sleep on.
The location is on the water as pictured, but it's a bit of a walk down a dirt embankment to a shore made of large irregular concrete blocks.
If you're sensitive to smells, let them know ahead of time so they can unplug the air fresheners.
We appreciated Marlene's guidance on some interesting things to do in the area. My sense is that they will answer any questions you have and address any concerns you share to the best of their abilities.
All told, it was a lovely place to stay and I can't speak highly enough of Marlene and Marvin. They are attentive, honest, and helpful hosts who are committed to helping their guests have a good visit.
Also, if you're looking for a place that is more secluded, you might prefer another cabin they own that is a bit more rustic. We might stay there on our next visit if it's available!

review_text: Linda is an excellent host who provides guests a comfy place in a very walkable neighborhood. This little apartment is fairly quiet, under other apartments, at the back of the attached building with a dedicated private parking space for one car. There is a full kitchen with stove/range, mini-fridge stocked with water and a couple of sugar sodas. Perfectly stocked cupboards with cookware, dishware, etc. However, there was no place to eat, and no warning of this before we booked. Only one chair and it was a big wing chair, not one that you could move around for eating. There's just no room for small table & 2 chairs in current kitchen configuration. So we needed to eat every meal out, rather than being able to cook. For one person, it would have been easy to cook, then eat by the bed in the wing chair, but for two people, it was impossible. Internet was excellent and fast, but as stated, no place for 2 people to work on laptops at the same time, unless one is in the bed. We were there in winter (snow, down to around 20 F at night), and the whole apartment stayed toasty warm. Didn't use the TV, which is atop a dresser, with router behind. Huge closet for your suitcases and hanging clothes. Tiny bathroom with it's own room heater! All-in-all this was a great stay in a sparking clean and pretty private apartment in the best part of downtown.

Context- I had a last minute personal trip that I had to run to with a few of friends. It came up quick and I didn’t have much time to react. We had to drive all night and needed a place to stay for the weekend.
Communication: Due to the nature of my trip, someone replying to me quickly and efficiently was something we really needed so we could get on the road ASAP. Jayne responded quickly and efficiently.
She was patient and warm in her responses about my questions (which I found out later, some of the answers I needed were already in her listing, my apologies!).
Hospitality: Jayne was incredibly warm in answering my questions. She was also personable in her responses and her amenities. She left us continental breakfast stating that we might need the “COFFEE” :).
Since we drove all night, it would mean checking in early would be a major advantage because we would be arriving very early and very tired. My host was flexible in allowing us to come early which meant the world to us. We were very tired from driving 14 hours.
One of my friends was outside and happened to run into her husband when she was outside. She said that he was a very pleasant individual and enjoyed their conversation. He even asked if there was anything he could do to improve our stay which was super appreciated.
Airbnb: Our cute place exactly like the photos (so accurate marketing!). It was a quiet and comfy home in Peru, IN. Our hosts took their time in adding personal touches to the home from decorations to plates and coffee mugs. We slept very well in the cozy and comfortable beds. The place was clean and spotless when we got it.
One cool amenity with this Airbnb different from most was an outside shower. This shower was located right under the deck stairs. A couple of my friends thought that it was the coolest thing in the world and tried it out.
Thank you for an amazing stay. ❤️
6/5 stars.
